title: We Read an Amazing Story, Chapter 4 with Editors Corrections 2
description: Chapter 4 begins by expressing that many organized religions and reporters in national publications like Colliers and Time have misrepresented the message of Psychiana and Psychiana's doctrine. Chapter goes on to describe the origins of Psychiana and clarifies the nature of Christ, Psychiana's teachings, and God's Power here on earth. This draft of chapter includes editorial corrections in ink. Missing pages 140 - 150.
creator: Robinson, Frank B.
subject: God-Power; Psychiana Criticism; Psychiana Origins; God on Earth

title: Out of this Chaos - What?
description: Twelve page typescript, written by Robinson during World War II, opens with the statement that a new civilization will be the result of the chaos war has created, but soon Robinson returns to his themes of the similarities between religions and ends the typescript with a description of the beginning of Psychiana.

He asserts, in his home, other beliefs are not true.

title: 1938 National Convention Speech - Lecture 3
description: One of four lectures delivered at the 1938 National Convention. In lecture three Robinson promises to provide examples of the Power of the Spirit of God manifested in every living thing. He uses several examples, including a flower that will not grow in sawdust but will grow in dirt because of a cosmic order that governs every living thing. Another example is plants that will grow in one climate and not another, among several other examples.

title: 1938 National Convention Speech - Lecture 4
description: One of four lectures delivered at the 1938 National Convention. In lecture four, Tenney begins by affirming that he will continue to support Psychiana and hopes to see a younger crowd. Robinson takes over, refuting accusations that he is an atheist. Robinson elaborates on how he differs from other orthodox religions on creed and dogma, but they all agree on the existence of God.

title: The Living Among The Dead
description: Typescript of an article discussing the nature of the infallibility of all orthodox religions. Robinson argues if they all claim to be right, then they may all be false. Robinson uses a biblical quote--'Why seek ye the living among the dead?'--to claim these religions believe in 'dead gods,' particularly those that are crucified.

Robins refutes heaven as a barrier created between us and God, but Psychiana affirms that we have access to all the things we want here and now on earth by communing with God and the God-Power.

subject: Here and Now; Afterlife; Miracles; Doctrine Parallels; God-Power; Success; Material Abindance

Robinson uses this question to call into question and refute central tenets of orthodox religious doctrine. Robinson discusses parallels of religious stories and ancient historians who fail to discuss Jesus Christ.

title: Psychiana No. 6
description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast. Episode begins with 'guide' asking Robinson about the nature of the virgin birth. Robinson refutes the virgin birth ever happened for several reasons, specifically it defies the God-Law governing nature and the story was borrowed from heathen and pagan myths, which Robinson discusses in specific detail. Robinson also discusses who actually authored the Gopels.

description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No.  17. Broadcast begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about orthodox religion, sparking a discussion about rewards and punishments, heaven and hell. title: Warning to Christians
description: Collage of writings almost entirely in all caps, cut up, and pasted together from various pieces of paper. Writings center around the central theme or focus that the doctrine of Christianity may not be true and that the world must come to grips with this fact or face the consequences of living this lie. Writings also include a list of indictments of Christianity. Robinson also includes a handwritten statement at the end expressing his intent to publish this collage in Spokane's largest newspaper.

This copy of the lecture is printed in a booklet entitled 'Psychiana (The Teaching Which Is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World)' and numbered 'Lecture No. 2'.

description: Radio program about Psychiana and Robinson's beliefs. Second transcript of six includes brief introduction of Robinson and discussion in which Robinson refutes the stories of orthodox religions as mere copies of stories from other religions and uses this lack of truth to discuss what he claims is the truth--the universal law of God on earth.

title: Flashes of Truth No. 3
description: Radio program about Psychiana and Robinson's beliefs. Third transcript of six includes brief introduction of Robinson and discussion in which Robinson claims that miracles like the virgin birth and resurrection are not true. He asserts that God would not break a law He created to govern the universe, uses myths from pagan religions for evidence against miracles, and discusses how miracles create barriers between people and God.

title: Psychiana Cosmic Rays
description: Radio transcript on Psychiana teachings. Transcript begins asserting man has long turned to the cosmos in search of answers and power, and that constellations and the comos operate according to the God-Law. Robinson then states he cannot take credit for this Law but it was revealed to him and people need to use it. He uses a letter from a woman in Michigan who is distraught about her marriage as an example of those who need the God-Law.

title: Psychiana Answer to Letter No. 4
description: Radio transcript on Psychiana teachings. Transcript begins with Robinson's response to the married woman who wrote a letter in the previous transcript,'Cosmic Rays.' Robinson asserts that 'cosmic rays' (often majestic rays scratched out in pencil and renamed cosmic) are a scientific fact no one can refute and asserts that two people should not disagree over facts. Transcript continues with more on cosmic power and another letter from a Psychiana student.

title: Psychiana No. 15 radio transcript
description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about the creation of the world via the God-Law and Genesis. Through dialogue, Robinson discusses contradictions that he finds in the book of Genesis that lead him to believe in the God-Law rather than Biblical accounts of Creation.

title: Psychiana No. 16 radio transcript
description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson questions about the exclusivity of confessing sins and absolution to Christianity, to which Robinson explains there are different permutations of confession and absolution in the Bible as well as other religions, including pagan religions. Robinson claims he exposes the Truth about orthodox religions.

title: Psychiana No. 17 radio transcript
description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about orthodox religion, sparking a discussion about rewards and punishments, heaven and hell. Robinson inquires whether heaven, as a physical place in space, actually exists and whether it makes sense to keep the prosperity of heaven out of one's reach until death if some 'force' or 'order' he calls God permeates the universe now.

title: Psychiana No. 18 radio transcript
description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with 'guide' reporting to Robinson that people have called him an atheist, to which Robinson responds by defining the term atheism, claiming he believes his God is 'far more intelligent' than the God of the Bible. He then criticizes orthodox religions, particularly Christianity, for the notion that sinners have to be 'saved.'

title: Miscellaneous Notes
description: Four unrelated, single-page documents with facts, lists, data, and quotes compiled for various reasons. Page 1 includes handwritten notes on letterhead from Davenport Hotel in Spokane, Washington, including facts about Psychiana, someone's plight to offer the truth about religion, and random phrases like 'agreeable moon cheese.' Page 2 includes data about the population and amount of orthodox churches in various states, concluding that only 10% of people attend church on Sundays and only 40% are on church registers. Page 3 includes fragments of what appears to be lecture notes on the real origin of orthodox beliefs and the current turmoil and godlessness of World War II. Page 4 includes the address of Saint Germain Press in Chicago, a list of book/journal titles, and two long quotes on opportunity and the nature of resentment in the American people.
subject: Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Lecture Notes; World War II
publisher-digital: University of Idaho Library Digital Initiatives, http://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/

title: Jack Holden Broadcast
description: Radio transcript of conversation between Jack Holden, Frank Robinson, and Henry Burr. Radio transcript records a discussion between Robinson, Holden, and Burr as they paraphrase from letters they claim have been written and either sent or wired to Robinson over the weekend. Various paraphrases include praise and testimonials from Psychiana students, correspondence from celebrities like Tommy Burns, and letters in regards to Robinson's material success.

title: The Flame
description: 'The Flame' is a single chapter, 26 pages in length, of perhaps a longer book. It exists both in the original and carbon typescript. The 'Flame' referred to is another name for what Robinson has called the 'Spirit of God' (see the manuscript 'The Pioneer' p. 14). There is, beginning on page eleven, a description of Long Crendon, Buckinghamshire, both when Robinson lived there as a child and when he visited in 1934.

Things like medical advances come from the Realm of the Spirit of God and therefore are not miracles.

description: One of four lectures delivered at the 1938 National Convention. In lecture two Tenney begins by explaining Psychiana is revising their lesson distribution method and asks for more donations, using student testimonials. Robinson continues his lecture on the growth of Psychiana and discusses the expansion of Psychiana in the face of old religions that ask people to give things up and blindly follow doctrines they say is true. He claims that people are looking for new Power and that is why Psychiana expands.

title: Compton Finds New Cosmic Ray Facts; Man, In Time, May Be Rebuilt
description: Clippings report the findings of scientist Dr. Arthur Holly Compton, who used a machine to take a closer look at cosmic rays striking the earth, and Professor Hans Spemann and Professor Ross G. Harrison who discovered the existence of an 'inductor' or 'organizer' in the embryonic tissue of animals.

title: The Humanist Pulpit - Did Jesus Rise from the Dead?
description: Pamphlet contains an address delivered before First Unitarian Society for distribution. Pamphlet discusses whether Jesus Christ rose from the dead, breaking this argument down into the evidence surrounding the ability for his physical body to have left his grave versus the idea of the resurrection based on faith rather than any concrete evidence. Includes annotations in pencil.
creator: Dietrich, John H.
subject: Jesus Christ; Religious Debates; Lectures
publisher-digital: University of Idaho Library Digital Initiatives - http://www.lib.uidaho.edu/digital/

title: The Humanist Pulpit - Did Jesus Really Live
description: Pamphlet contains an address delivered before First Unitarian Society for distribution. Pamphlet discusses the controversy surrounding the claim that Jesus of Nazareth, the man who walked the earth as the manifestation of God, never actually existed in history and recounts historical arguments for and against this claim.
creator: Dietrich, John H.
subject: Jesus Christ; Religious Debates; Lectures

title: The Humanist Pulpit - What's Happening to Religion
description: Pamphlet contains an address delivered before First Unitarian Society for distribution. Pamphlet discusses history of religion, then many different denominations that split from Catholicism, and how religion has changed through the course of history due to innovations like agriculture and events like World War II. Includes handwritten annotations.

description: Letter details 'JLK's' actions on August 31, 1946 as well as musings about Russia and Turkey, war, greed, and other topics. Also includes of list of words defined objectively, 'prophecies', and several drawings and doodles done by hand.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Lesson No. 1 with Special Instructions to Our Students
description: First lesson mailed to students of Psychiana includes an introduction to teachings and asks readers not to question what Robinson says, establishing roles of 'teacher' and 'student.' Robinson also asks readers to dispel any notion of a 'subconscious mind' in lieu of some other force. Robinson instructs readers about quiet meditation, mantras, and other practices.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Lesson No. 2 - The Story of Creation
description: Lesson discusses relationship between science and the Bible as they pertain to the story of creation. Robinson claims science and the Bible are not in opposition, but 'corroborate' or 'dovetail' each other. He discusses interpretation, and eventually creates a hierarchy of science over religion when the two clash (i.e. is it possible that the world was truly created in 6 days?).
creator: Robinson, Frank B.

title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 3 - Who and What God Actually Is
description: Lesson discusses what God is and multiple ways men defined God over thousands of years. Robinson also discusses Jesus as the most qualified to reveal what god is and draws attention to poor translations of Jesus' words by average men: God is not 'a spirit' but that God 'is spirit.' He defines God as 'a presence' and 'a dynamic power in the universe,' giving examples of how the force that God is works on earth.
creator: Robinson, Frank B.
related-publication: Jesus Christ; God-Power; God on Earth; Bible; God-Law Examples; Living God

title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 4 - The Creation and Fall of Man
description: Lesson discusses the story of Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden, and the moment of the Fall. Robinson uses to Fall not as humanity's decent into sin, but rather the point at which man's eyes opened to the physical world and closed to the spiritual world. This creates a 'senses veil' that does not allow people to see God as he works on earth among us. Robinson then encourages students to use their lesson time to sit quietly, concentrate, and talk directly to God.
creator: Robinson, Frank B.
related-publication: Adam and Eve; The Fall; Senses Veil; Realm of the Spirit of God; Talking With God

title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 6 - Jesus--Who He Was and What He Came To Do
description: Lesson begins discussion of Robinson's relationship with Jesus Christ. He discusses the separation of the physical and spiritual worlds, stating that it's true the two are separate but calls the Christian belief that people can only access the spiritual realm after death, in heaven, a shame. Robinson asserts the shame of religion is that it clouds truths of God and Jesus as they were originally taught.
creator: Robinson, Frank B.
related-publication: Jesus Christ; Afterlife; God on Earth; Criticizing Orthodox Religions

title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 7 - Jesus--Who He was and What He Came To Do--(Cont.)
description: Lesson includes Robinson's interpretations of the Bible and life of Jesus Christ from birth to resurrection. Robinson debates whether Jesus Christ actually was a God and whether Jesus was different, biologically at least, from any other human being on earth. Robinson concludes Jesus' power is evidenced to come from the 'Life Spirit,' which can be duplicated on earth now.

title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 8 - Jesus--Who He Was and What He Came To Do--(Cont.)
description: Lesson continues discussion of Jesus Christ, maintaining that Jesus was just as much man as he was God. Robinson discusses 'New Psychology' and its discovery of the Living God, though it doesn't call It God. He tells an anecdote about a hen with a broken leg that healed after he thanked God in advance for healing it, and asserts that miracles don't exist because miracles are the Power of the Living God and only happen if the Living God wills them.

title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 9 - Healing
description: Lesson discusses nature and science of healing. Robinson discusses drug trials and why so many people rely on drugs like aspirin to cure ailments. Robinson also discusses the money the drug industry has tied up in medicine and uses healing as a platform to assert that there is no need for drugs if people only trusted the Power of the Spirit of God.

title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 10 - How to Take What You Need
description: Final lessons in first course asserts that students now have the same methods that Christ used while he lived on earth. Robinson also discusses the Power or getting what you want, and uses Biblical quotes and promises that people will get what they want if they pray, even in a time of 'unbelief' when 'affirmations of faith are necessary.' Robinson asks students to use the affirmation 'I believe in the Living God' until they get an 'answer' to what they want.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course - Introductory Lecture
description: First Advanced Lesson asks students to read in a quiet place. Robinson discusses an 'immutable, inviolable, and never-changing Law' that governs the universe. He offers examples of this law: geese flying in a 'V' by instinct, seeds sprouting, etc. He then discusses the discoveries of 'New Psychology,' and the Power that has been called the subconscious mind.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 1
description: Advanced lesson focuses primarily on the nature of success and failure. Robinson appeals to those who 'struggle with unhappiness, ill health, lack of money, or business failure.' He discusses the cosmos and how the same Immutable Law, or God-Law, that governs the stars also governs 'HEALTH, HAPPINESS, and MATERIAL ABUNDANCE' and many people don't know how to use this Power.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 2
description: Advanced lesson discusses life as a card game, where cards are the lives we inherit including education, circumstances, and fortune. Robinson discusses how to change a 'losing hand' through the God-Law. Robinson discusses the clash between religion and his teachings, and asserts that God is not a being to be feared but a force we can commune with for mastery over our lives.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 3
description: Advanced lesson discusses the creation of man and earth. Robinson expresses his disbelief in traditional doctrine that God is a being located in heaven, or a far place, while asserting that their is a force acting and creating on earth. He compares creation theories of science and evolution to Biblical accounts. He uses the terms 'Law' and 'Power' interchangeably.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 4
description: Advanced lesson promises happiness and success to students who understand the God-Law. Robinson discusses rifts between doctrines of orthodox religion and Psychiana. He claims Jesus is not divine and maintains that Psychiana offers a commune with God, a Spiritual Force acting  on Earth. Repeats passages from Lesson No. 3 in first, non-advanced 10 lessons.

description: Advanced lesson begins reviewing advanced lessons 1 - 4, then discusses the magnitude of the God-Law though astronomy. Robinson equates the God-Law with the laws of physics that govern newly discovered stars, cosmic distances, and planetary systems unknown when beliefs in orthodox religions were originally founded.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 6
description: Advanced lesson focuses on the development of knowledge and philosophy since the  dark ages. Robinson refers to many different thinkers, including St. Augustine, Spinoza, and Immanuel Kant, and developments in fields of science and astronomy. Robinson also discusses the nature of religious theories or 'guess work' established during past periods of primitive thought.

description: Advanced lesson focuses on the terminology of the God-Law as a Law, which Robinson maintains is not subject to varying interpretation like gods of other religions because it is a law, like a law in nature. Robinson discusses a force or law that governs how cellular biology and astronomy work as examples of the God-Law.

description: Advanced lesson begins discussing discovery of the 'cosmic ray' as proof that some law or force exists in the universe. Robinson draws correlations between deities in different religions as evidence that religion borrows and shares information. He calls theology and religion 'guess work' at finding the true existence of the force that is God.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 9
description: Advanced lesson establishes idea that man never 'fell,' but instead climbs from cave-man understanding to our current understanding of the world. Robinson asserts that the only limitation in accessing the God-Law and God-Power and using it to your advantage is yourself. Robinson also discusses original sin and the Christian creation story as myth.

description: Advanced lessons asserts the God-Power is always on and working all the time, and stresses the importance of grasping what that means. He asserts that the God-Power works for anyone of any race throughout the world. He gives various examples to show constancy and potential of the God-Power even if it is not 'complied with.'

description: Advanced lesson is an extended anecdote of Robinson's life and how he came to know the God-Law. Robinson begins with his childhood and father, a Baptist minister. He tells of his hardships before Psychiana and how he came to success through Psychiana and the little affirmations that he says every day as he spreads his teachings to others.

description: Advanced lesson centers around articles by the associated press in which scientists have offered discovers and theories about the expanding of the universe, life in distant galaxies, the Big Bang, etc. Robinson also claims that no scientists believe in the Biblical story of Creation and scientists that were once atheists are prescribing to beliefs in larger forces.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 13
description: Advanced lesson focuses on Jesus Christ, which Robinson often refers to by his profession, the Galilean Carpenter. Robinson draws a correlation between astronomy and history and between 'saviors' in other religions to refute the 'supernatural' surrounding Christ's birth. Robinson does not doubt he was born and lived, and discusses Christ's likeable personality and how he was misunderstood.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 14
description: Advanced lesson begins by stating that students should be ready to use the God-Power in their lives, then turns to a discussion of the secret of Christ's power. Robinson discusses that miracles don't exist, and that miracles are really  the Creative Spirit of Life, the God-Law, acting in 'perfect naturalness.' He discusses how Christ harnessed the God-Power and students can as well.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 15
description: Advanced lesson recaps the previous lesson, reminding students they can access the God-Power, then discusses what students can do with this God-Power once they access it. Robinson asserts it is impossible to make a failure of your life if you accept the God-Power, and you can acquire all that you need. For example, if the God-Power can make a lily beautiful, why can't it provide you with the best apparel?

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 16
description: Advanced lesson begins citing Associated Press articles about the discovery of the neutron. Robinsons uses this, and facts about the size of the neutron, to further reiterate that the unseen force he calls the God-Law is working in the present day, and we are discovering more and more about it every day. He also prophesizes about the fate of the world in the advent of these discoveries.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 17
description: Advanced lesson discusses the central topic of Life. Robinson describes a scene in a city without life, where all things would stop if Life didn't exist, and deduces that you (speaking to the reader) are life now. He stresses the importance of the temporal and the God-Law happening now, on earth. Robinson criticizes orthodox religions for doctrines that prevent people from knowing anything about Life until they die.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 18
description: Advanced lesson discusses the role of happiness from material possessions and nonmaterial things, especially a direct relationship with God. Robinson tells an anecdote about an exhibit of torture devices he claims were used by the Christian church to punish heretics, then further discusses the idea of opening the 'mansion' to the Realm of God with the 'key of peace.'

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which Is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 2
description: Lesson discusses the topic of 'worship.' Robinson claims the God of Psychiana does not need worship or tribute, but rather to be contacted and used. He reiterates the importance of meditation and affirmations as practices to contact this God. He also discusses Jesus Christ as a man who contacted this God and used It.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 19
description: Advanced lesson works to define the Spiritual Realm and our connection to it. Robinson distinguishes the God-Power from the will, and attributes the growth of Psychiana to knowing the God-Power. Robinson recaps the connection to the Spiritual Realm via electrical signals in our brains, like cosmic rays in space, that are forces he calls God acting through us.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 3
description: Lesson begins discussing the magnitude of the Power of God. Robinson then discusses eternal life, which he claims can be achieved through the God-Power. He claims this is our main purpose. He also quotes several scientists and other texts about the cosmos and other discoveries of science as illustrations of forces and powers in nature.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 4
description: Lesson discusses, at length, the discovery of the 'cosmic ray' and attempts to further impress upon students the existence of a Law or Force working through the Universe. Robinson coins a new term, 'Realm of the Cosmic Ray.' Robinson also discusses how people have resisted technological advances in history like they resist Psychiana, and how the Power manifests itself positively in Robinson's own life.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 5
description: Lesson discusses people getting close to the Realm of God and seeing what Robinson calls 'Spiritual Faces.' He tells the story of seeing manifestations of people and corpses when he needed a name for his religion for his first advertising deadline. This is where the name Psychiana came from - a vision. Robinson also discusses what the manifestation the God-Power will be like for students.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 6
description: Lesson discusses the demand by young people for a new, satisfying religion. Robinson also tells anecdotes of witnessing death in the natural world among animals and war in human history. He claims these circumstances are the God-Law allowed to run wild. Finally he discusses excerpts from Revelation, calling John 'the Dreamer,' and how a great leveling is happening in the present economic and physical world.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 7
description: Lesson discusses the nature of doubt in all people. First, Robinson gives examples of evolution and progress that he claims are examples the God-Law is working and creating progress. Among the examples, he includes political and social reforms, like communism. He then discusses the nature of doubt and attempts to prove, through God Itself, that what Robinson preaches is Truth.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 8
description: Lesson focuses on a discussion of fear, what it is and where it comes from. Robinson traces fear back to an instinct to survive in animals. He introduces a notion he calls the 'separated self' and claims that he is both a mystic and atheist, if that is what people want to call him, for his beliefs about natural feelings of fear and survival as opposed to natural want of happiness and comfort.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 9
description: Lesson focuses on discussions of 'Faith' and 'Immortality,' defining either term and discussing its contemporary definition through orthodox doctrine, the miracle of the Resurrection, and history. Robinson equates the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ with historic assassinations of U.S. presidents. Robinson also discusses the Gospels as sources of information about Immortality and historical accuracy.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 10
description: Lesson continues discussion of immortality and history. Robinson starts discussing free will and the futility of Sin in a world where actions are predetermined. He also discusses the culmination of history in terms of the ideas of humans and asks where the idea comes from. Finally, he discusses outside influences on individuals that contribute to fear and other negative developments and perceptions in the mind.

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 1
description: Advanced teaching lesson designed for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson discusses knowledge and the purpose and source of where education and knowledge come from. Robinson discusses role of teachers, particularly priests, and criticizes Christian methods of torturing heretics. Robinson also summarizes what student-teachers can expect in lessons to come, stating he hasn't revealed all his knowledge yet.

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 2
description: Advanced teaching lesson designed for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson promises material and financial remuneration. Robinson also criticizes teaching methods of the 'church' and preachers like Billy Sunday, and makes several accusations against the Salvation Army. He offers his interpretations on the genealogy of Jesus, quoting from the Gospels.

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 3
description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson focuses primarily on Robinson's views of doctrines in other religions. Robinson claims Psychiana's growth is due to his fierce honesty, and he locates himself and Psychiana in opposition of all other organized, orthodox religions. He denies the story of Christ and offers his views, in list format, on the Bible and doctrine derived therefrom.

title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 20
description: Final lesson of advanced course number one seeks to recap nomenclature (somewhat interchangeably) and relationship between the Spirit of God, God Realm or Spiritual Realm, God-Law,  Life Principle or Life Spirit, and God-Power. Robinson speaks metaphorically of plumbing and water pumped into every home from a reservoir, and defines a new term he calls 'The Great Without,' or power coming from outside the body, from nature and the cosmos.

description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson focuses further on dispelling stories and foundational teachings of orthodox religions. Robinson uses the genealogy of Christ, the words of Clarence Darrow, and the case of Michael Servetus's heresy and execution as examples of the lack of validity of orthodox religion, particularly Christianity.

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 5
description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson compares stories of saviors and deities from multiple religions, from pagan religions to Christianity, in order to draw correlations and make claims that stories, myths, and doctrine are often drawn from similar sources and origin stories despite each religion's claim that their doctrine is 'right' or 'true.'

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 6
description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson further catalogues what Robinson calls the 'sixteen crucified Saviors of the world.' Robinson summarizes crucifixion stories from as far back as 725 b.c. from many different religions and countries throughout the world. Robinson discusses origins of the crucifixion myth and inconsistencies between historical accounts and Biblical evangelist accounts.

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which Is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 1
description: Lesson reprints two letters and a wire Robinson claims to have received from people needing or asking for help and then having their problems--whether financial, health related or other--answered by 'contacting' the God-Realm and asking for what they desired. Robinson focuses on contacting the God-Realm to get what one desires as in his letters and examples, and reminds students to do his meditation and affirmation exercises.

description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 14
description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson focuses on the story of Creation, claiming the Biblical story of Creation is not true and using science and specifically facts of astronomy, cosmology, anatomy, and biology to discuss how both the universe and people were formed by a natural law that governs all things. Robinson uses the terms God-Power and God-Law interchangeably.
creator: Robinson, Frank B.
related-publication: Creation Stories; Science and Technology; Solar System; God-Law; God-Power; Cosmos; Biological Law; Spreading Psychiana

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 9
description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson further discusses correlation between religious and pagan stories, focusing primarily on the doctrine and 'character' the Holy Ghost. Robinson lists several places where the Holy Ghost is mentioned in the Bible, and then discusses the different permutations, manifestations, and entities of the Holy Ghost in different mono and polytheistic religions.
creator: Robinson, Frank B.
related-publication: Oriental Mythology; Holy Ghost; Doctrine Parallels; Holy Ghost Origin; Bible; Spreading Psychiana

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 15
description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson continues discussion of creation, focusing on the connection between the spiritual and material worlds. Robinson discusses the Life Spirit, which animates the body, and also stresses that death is the act of the Life Spirit leaving the body because it sees the body failing to take control. Robinson also discusses the brutality of martyrdom and other violent acts in the name of religion.
creator: Robinson, Frank B.
related-publication: Life Spirit; Death; God-Realm; Martyrdom; Religious Brutality; Spreading Psychiana

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 16
description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson begins with a poem, and discusses the law that governs nature. Robinson provides several examples of the way things occur in nature as evidence of the God-Law, or force that governs nature, that comes from the Spiritual Realm to govern all things. Robinson makes prophecies of the future, claiming that evolution of man is not complete.
creator: Robinson, Frank B.

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 17
description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson begins discussing the fate of orthodox religion. Robinson discusses the vast differences socially and economically in America from 1917 to 1936, and the disillusionment and lack of faith people have in doctrines both secular and religious. He claims they no longer trust the institutions that were once and remain in place. He also uses a variety of quotes from writers, generals, leaders, etc. Missing end page(s).

title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 18
description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson begins with the continuation of an address made by George H. Cless, Jr., though the previous lesson doesn't seem to end with Cless's address. Lesson claims the Church is facing its biggest challenge in recent years. Aside from hard-to-believe doctrine, he discusses people's recent disillusionment with religion, using several quotes to support himself.

title: Correspondence with Arthur James Holbrook

Robinson in return for all the great things Robinson has done for him.
